column1: ralph e. shell| ralph e. shell
column5: 2015. ralph was born in liberty township
column7: 1918 to the late raymond james and ella (holmes) shell. he proudly served his country in the u. s. army during wwii. ralph worked at findlay high school as the orchestra and band director
column8: where he was an inspiration to many inspiring musicians. he also founded and directed the findlay civic band. after retirement he taught music at hope temple christian school. ralph had a deep love for the lord and often used his musical talents in worship and praise. he will be greatly missed by his extended family and loving friends. ralph is survived by his loving wife of 69 years
column9: ruby (mc. neil); dear children janet shell
column11: and roger (kathe) shell. he is preceded in death by his brother carl shell. funeral services will be held tuesday
column13: 2015 at 11 a. m. at waite and son funeral home
column15: medina. his son-in-law rev. jeff kolodziej will preside over the services. friends may call monday from 2-4 and 6-8 p. m. at the funeral home. burial with military honors will take place at ohio western reserve national cemetery on thursday june 18
column17: the family requests donations be sent to psalmist global ralph shell memorial scholarship fund
